items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: Mud Terrain
items.description: Mud Terrain tires offer drivers traction on off-road terrains such as mud, dirt, sand, gravel, and rock, and are commonly used on CUVs, SUVs, light trucks, and jeeps.

items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: Commercial Van
items.description: Also known as cargo tires, commercial van tires feature a C at the end of the tire's size and are built with durable, long-lasting materials to help drivers as they haul packages in pickup and delivery applications.

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 275-70r18 drivers
Check out the sale price on this tire
Consistently rated as excellent by 275-70r18 drivers

content.body:
### Shop 275/70R18 Tire Size
275/70R18 tires have been around since 2005 and are typically found on larger trucks. If you drive a Chevrolet Silverado 2500 HD, Ford F-350 Super Duty, GMC Sierra 2500 HD, Nissan Titan PRO-4X, or RAM 2500, then you might have a set of 275/70R18 tires, and a brand new version of one of these trucks might come with a set of Hankook Dynapro MT2 RT05, Goodyear Wrangler All-Terrain Adventure with Kevlar Pro-Grade,[Michelin LTX A/T2](https://simpletire.com/brands/michelin-tires/ltx-a-t-2), General Grabber APT, Firestone Transforce HT attached.

Popular vehicles: 
2020-2021 Chevrolet Silverado 2500 HD
2005-2021 Ford F-350 Super Duty
2020-2021 GMC Sierra 2500 HD
2008-2021 Nissan Titan PRO-4X
2014-2021 RAM 2500

All-season tires give drivers consistent traction in dry, wet, and light winter weather conditions, which makes them a popular choice among drivers. Take a look at the Continental TerrainContact H/T, Falken Wildpeak H/T02, Nokian One H/T, and [Kumho Crugen HT51](https://simpletire.com/brands/kumho-tires/crugen-ht51), if you want a set of 275/70R18 that’s built to perform year-round.

Maybe you need a new set of all-terrain tires and want to try something different than your ride’s OE. Check out the BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2, Yokohama Geolandar AT G015,[Falken Wildpeak A/T3W](https://simpletire.com/brands/falken-tires/wildpeak-a-t3w), and GT Radial Adventuro AT3 if you need a set of 275/70R18 tires that are built to perform on any terrain.

While all-terrain tires are able to perform on any terrain, their rubber compound does typically harden when temperatures drop below 45 degrees Fahrenheit. Fortunately, winter tires are built to perform in ice, slush, snow, and lower temperatures so consider the[Bridgestone Blizzak LT](https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/blizzak-lt), General Grabber Arctic LT, Hankook Winter iPike (RW11), and Toyo Open Country WLT1 if you need a dedicated set of 275/70R18 winter tires for your truck.

Whether you drive a Chevrolet Silverado 2500 HD, Ford F-350 Super Duty, RAM 2500, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 275/70R18 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
